decks.notes: The deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug then utilizing cards like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam to create an overwhelming board presence. Using cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to win through explosive graveyard-based combo plays rather than traditional creature combat. The inclusion of cards like Creeping Chill and Hollow One also adds additional angles of attack to keep the opponent off balance.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It includes various counterspells and draw spells to protect and search for pieces of the combo, such as Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. The deck also utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Dark Ritual and the Moxen to quickly cast Doomsday. The goal is to cast Doomsday, stack the deck in a specific order, and then win the game by drawing from an empty library with Thassa's Oracle. The deck prioritizes efficiency and speed in order to win quickly before the opponent can react.

The deck focuses on using efficient spells and card advantage to control the game while maintaining a strong tempo with aggressive creatures. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will and Dack Fayden, along with disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own threats. The combination of countermagic, card draw, and versatile threats allows the deck to adapt to different matchups and stay ahead in the game through incremental advantages.

This deck is focused on quickly deploying threats while disrupting opponents' game plans with counterspells and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game. With a mix of disruptive spells like Pyroblast and Swords to Plowshares, along with powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and close out games quickly. Jeskai Xerox is all about efficient card advantage, control, and aggression.

The deck is focused on utilizing artifacts to control and disrupt opponent's strategies while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It includes powerful artifact ramp cards like Mishra's Workshop and mana acceleration with Moxen. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide land disruption while Sorcerous Spyglass can shut down key activated abilities. The deck also features utility cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Karn, the Great Creator for additional control options. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck aims to generate a lot of mana quickly through artifact acceleration and spells like Paradoxical Outcome. The key strategy is to draw cards and replay artifacts with Outcome to generate even more mana and card advantage. This allows the player to set up a powerful combo turn, potentially involving cards like Bolas's Citadel or Tinker to win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Lavinia to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to win the game quickly with a big explosive turn.

This deck focuses on utilizing the mechanics of Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill the graveyard and generate card advantage. It aims to establish an aggressive board presence by deploying low-cost creatures such as Basking Rootwalla, Bloodghast, Hollow One, and Krovikan Horror. The deck includes various disruptive elements like Mental Misstep, Force of Will, and Contagion to impede opponents' strategies. Additionally, the deck incorporates powerful legends like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and The Ur-Dragon to establish dominance on the battlefield. The inclusion of Wasteland and Strip Mine helps disrupt opponents' land base while Gaea's Cradle provides additional mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on utilizing planeswalkers and high-value cards to control the game, using powerful spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast to disrupt opponents. It also includes efficient card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dreadhorde Arcanist provides additional threats, while Wrenn and Six, Oko, and Narset help generate value and protect the planeswalkers. The mana base is streamlined for consistency, with a mix of fetch lands and moxen for early acceleration.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Bazaar of Baghdad, allowing for powerful early plays such as casting Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis or bringing back Vengevine and Bloodghast. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Hollow One and Basking Rootwalla, while utilizing disruption cards like Wasteland and Force of Vigor to control the game. The inclusion of Deathrite Shaman also provides additional graveyard hate and mana acceleration to further push the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and powerful spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Young Pyromancer to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. It also includes disruption tools like Daze and Flusterstorm to protect its threats. The inclusion of Narset, Parter of Veils and Ashiok, Dream Render helps control the opponent's resources while cards like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise provide card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a consistent and aggressive tempo to secure the win.

The deck is focused on using artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of aggressive threats like Walking Ballista and Stonecoil Serpent, along with disruptive pieces like Chalice of the Void and Sphere of Resistance, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also putting pressure on them. Mishra's Workshop and other mana accelerants allow for explosive starts, while cards like Lodestone Golem and Trinisphere make it difficult for the opponent to cast spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Paradoxical Outcome, Bolas's Citadel, and various mana accelerants like Moxen and Sol Ring to generate massive card advantage and mana to quickly assemble a game-winning combo. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and interaction pieces like Lavinia and Narset to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently win the game through the combo while controlling the game with powerful spells and card draw.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and disruption through efficient spells and powerful planeswalkers. By utilizing cantrips like Brainstorm and Preordain, along with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, the deck aims to find key threats like Young Pyromancer and Monastery Mentor to apply pressure on the opponent. With a suite of counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Pyroblast, along with removal like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt, the deck can protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan while chipping away at their life total.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, then using Bazaar of Baghdad and other cards to continually bring them back for aggressive plays. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, using graveyard synergy and efficient creatures to maintain a strong board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Vigor and Deathrite Shaman to control the pace of the game and prevent the opponent from mounting a defense.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana and drawing cards efficiently before using cards like Paradoxical Outcome to return multiple artifacts to hand and draw even more cards. The goal is to assemble a powerful board state quickly through a combination of mana acceleration, card draw, and recursion effects. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade helps to slow down opponents and protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game through overwhelming the opponent with a critical mass of artifacts and spells.

This deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and efficient control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing board presence. By generating card advantage through cards like Dack Fayden and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Pyroblast, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. The inclusion of key cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk provide extra sources of card advantage and tempo advantage, giving the deck multiple ways to pull ahead in the game.
